Zolpidem (Ambien)

Legal Status

by Erowid

U.S. FEDERAL LAW #

Caution : All legal information should be verified through other sources. [see below]

U.S. FEDERAL LEGAL SUMMARY Zolpidem REGULATED Yes STATUS Scheduled SCHEDULE Schedule IV CLASSIFICATION Depressant


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt provides detailed legal status information on zolpidem (Ambien), including its scheduling and regulatory status across various countries such as the U.S., Australia, Canada, and European nations. It is part of the broader pharmaceutical and drug law section of the webpage, offering legal reference data crucial for understanding the substance's legal control worldwide.

metadata.title: Erowid Zolpidem (Ambien) Vault : Legal Status
metadata.description: Information on the legal status of Zolpidem (Ambien).

content:
Drug: Zolpidem | cid: None
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on the legal status of Zolpidem (Ambien).
Erowid name: zolpidem
Category: PHARMS
Field: Law

                    Text: 
                    U.S. FEDERAL LEGAL SUMMARY Zolpidem REGULATED Yes STATUS Scheduled SCHEDULE Schedule IV CLASSIFICATION Depressant

Zolpidem is Schedule IV in the U.S. This means it is illegal to sell without a license and illegal to possess without a valid license or prescription.

INTERNATIONAL LAW #

Australia #

Zolpidem is available by prescription only in Australia, but is subject to tighter controls than regular S4 prescription medications. There is a list of Schedule 4 (S4) drugs that have additional controls under "Appendix D". The group is refered to as "S4D" substances. Prescribing these invites additional scrutiny and posssessing them can involve some additional scrutiny. Info about this group, that includes zolpidem, can be found https://www.health.nsw.gov.au/pharmaceutical/Pages/sch4d.aspx. (Thanks LF) (last updated 2022 Feb 9)

Canada #


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt provides a detailed legal status overview of zolpidem in the United States and select countries, including its classification as Schedule IV and specific regulations in Australia, Canada, and other nations. It is relevant to the broader document's focus on drug laws, legal classifications, and international regulations surrounding psychoactive substances.

metadata.title: Erowid Zolpidem (Ambien) Vault : Legal Status
metadata.description: Information on the legal status of Zolpidem (Ambien).

content:
Drug: Zolpidem | cid: None
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on the legal status of Zolpidem (Ambien).
Erowid name: zolpidem
Category: PHARMS
Field: Law

                    Text: 
                    Canada #

Zolpidem is available by prescription only in Canada and is a Schedule IV drug, in the same schedule as benzodiazepines. Possession of Schedule IV drugs in Canada is not a crime unless for the purposes of distribution. Seeking to obtain Schedule IV drugs such as zolpidem is a illegal in Canada. (thanks br) (last updated Aug 6 2014)

Germany #

Zolpidem is available by prescription only in Germany. (thanks P)

Finland #

We received a report that zolpidem is available by prescription only in Finland. (unconfirmed) (thanks T)

France #

We received a report that zolpidem is only available by prescription in France. (unconfirmed) (thanks M)

Italy (Italia) #

Zolpidem is available by prescription only. The most common commercial name is Stilnox. (unconfirmed) (thanks PM) (last updated Sep 8 2009)

New Zealand #

Zolpidem is available by prescription only in New Zealand. (thanks br) (last updated Apr 25 2011)

Norway #


                    Context: 
                    This chunk provides detailed legal status information for zolpidem in multiple countries, including Canada, Germany, Finland, France, Italy, New Zealand, and Norway. It is part of the broader section on zolpidem's legal classification and restrictions, essential for understanding international regulation and access. These details are crucial for users researching drug legality and prescription requirements worldwide.

metadata.title: Erowid Zolpidem (Ambien) Vault : Legal Status
metadata.description: Information on the legal status of Zolpidem (Ambien).

content:
Drug: Zolpidem | cid: None
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on the legal status of Zolpidem (Ambien).
Erowid name: zolpidem
Category: PHARMS
Field: Law

                    Text: 
                    New Zealand #

Zolpidem is available by prescription only in New Zealand. (thanks br) (last updated Apr 25 2011)

Norway #

Zolpidem is available by prescription only in Norway, and we have been told that it is very uncommon. (thanks AV) (last updated May 2007)

Portugal #

Zolpidem is available by prescription only in Portugal. (last updated Apr 26 2016)

Sweden #

Zolpidem is available only with a prescription in Sweden. It is reportedly less available to those under the age of 18. (unconfirmed) (thanks C,E) (last updated Oct 1 2009)

United Kingdom (U.K., England, Scotland, Wales) #

Zolpidem is available only with a prescription and is a Class C drug under the Misuse of Drugs Act. See http://www.homeoffice.gov.uk/about-us/corporate-publications-strategy/home-office-circulars/circulars-2003/039-2003/. (thanks K) (last updated May 3 2012)

If you have information about the legal status of this substance in any other country, please let us know.

CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #


                    Context: 
                    This chunk provides legal status information for Zolpidem in select countries, including New Zealand, Norway, Portugal, Sweden, and the UK, highlighting prescription requirements and classification details. It is part of a broader section on substance legality, aiding users in understanding international regulations related to Zolpidem. The details include recent updates, restrictions, and a request for additional country data.

                    Text: 
                    If you have information about the legal status of this substance in any other country, please let us know.

CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid legal information is a summary of data gathered from site visitors, government documents, websites, and other resources. We are not lawyers and can not guarantee the accuracy of the information provided here. We do our best to keep this information correct and up-to-date, but laws are complex and constantly changing. Laws may also vary from one jurisdiction to another (county, state, country, etc)...this list is not comprehensive.

RELATED RESOURCES #
